model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain information that is both useful and relevant, enabling the Speaker B to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Do you use technology like text messaging to interact with your grandkids?
Speaker B: No I can't get my head round it, I much rather a good ol fashioned phone call!
Speaker A: I have had to learn just to keep in touch with my family because of my hours at my job. It is not easy, I understand.
Speaker B: Well thankfully I don't have that problem these days, I get to spend some great time with my grandkids. Have you thought any more about the idea of our annual fishing trip? 
Speaker A: Yes, I think you should start planning this with your family and try and do different locations every year so that it changes up the scenery 

MEMORY 1:
1. Speaker B likes the idea of making the fishing trip an annual tradition to get the grandkids more interested in nature.
2. Speaker B took their grandkids fishing once, with mixed reactions from the kids.
3. Speaker B has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park.
4. Speaker B has grandkids who are more interested in phones and tablets than musical instruments.
5. Speaker A has kids and is busy with work, unable to spend as much time with them as they would like.
6. Speaker B mentions having grandkids, implying they are older and have a family of their own.

MEMORY 2:
Speaker B has a lot of kids, all grown up now and with kids of their own. This causes Speaker A to have kids and be busy with work, unable to spend as much time with them as they would like. Speaker B, in turn, wants to spend time with their grandkids at the park, enjoying the idea of making the fishing trip an annual tradition to get the grandkids more interested in nature.

Speaker A, a librarian who loves kids, mentions having 3 children. This leads to Speaker A being busy with work and unable to spend as much time with their kids as they would like. Speaker B, who has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park, took their grandkids fishing once, with mixed reactions from the kids.

YOUR OUTPUT:
prediction:

Memory 1 contains information about Speaker B's interest in making the fishing trip an annual tradition to get the grandkids more interested in nature, which directly aligns with the dialogue context. It also includes relevant details about the mixed reactions from the grandkids on a past fishing trip, which can inform Speaker B's response. Memory 2, while providing a broader background, repeats some of the similar insights found in Memory 1 but does add details about Speaker A being a librarianâ€”which is not directly relevant to the fishing trip discussion.
